business.headline: India agreed to open agriculture, dairy sectors to US players? Piyush Goyal answersEarlier, Piyush Goyal shared the details of the deal that followed a framework interim trade agreement between the two countries, aimed at boosting exports, jobs and market access. The trade deal will formally be signed in March.

Reduced US tariffs of 18% on India come into effect. What it meansThe agreement will reduce US reciprocal duties on Indian exports to 18 per cent, while scrapping tariffs entirely on items such as generic medicines, gems and diamonds, and aircraft components—opening up stronger export prospects across several key sectors.

India-US trade deal to boost exports, safeguard farmers' interests: Piyush GoyalUnion Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal said the India-US interim trade framework is a historic step toward achieving USD 500 billion in bilateral trade. He announced that reciprocal tariffs on Indian exports to the US will fall sharply from 50% to 18%.

Protection of farmers' interest in US deal surprised some: Govt's dig at OppositionPiyush Goyal dismissed criticism that the India-US trade deal would harm farmers and small producers, asserting that the interim framework fully safeguards their interests.

How India flipped the agri script on Trump? Piyush Goyal revealsUnion Minister Piyush Goyal stressed that India maintained its red lines on agriculture and dairy in its trade deal with the US, while opening its market selectively for certain items like wines and spirits.

What happens if the world's 10 richest people donate half their wealth?A trillion dollars from the world's richest may feel impossible, but pledges like Vedanta chairman Anil Agarwal's prove that big commitments are possible. Imagine what happens if the top ten step forward.

India–US trade deal: Decoding impact of lower 18% tariffs and duty-free boostIndian goods that were slammed with nearly 50% US tariffs last year will now face only 18%, and some key sectors even go duty-free. Here's how the interim pact changes the outlook for exporters.

India to buy $500 billion of US goods in 5 years as new trade deal cuts tariffsIndia's USD 500 billion buying plan will anchor the interim trade framework, as New Delhi will cut tariffs on US goods and Washington will lower duties on Indian exports to 18 per cent under the proposed bilateral pact.

18% tariff, wider US market access: How India gains from trade pact with USIndia and the US have finally agreed on a framework for an interim trade agreement. In this article, we break down what it means and why it matters for India.

Tariffs to fall, markets to open, lakhs of jobs: Piyush Goyal on India-US dealThe agreement will see the US cut reciprocal tariffs on Indian goods to 18 per cent and eliminate duties on products such as generic pharmaceuticals, gems and diamonds, and aircraft parts, boosting export opportunities across key sectors.

India, US unveil interim trade pact; cut tariffs, open $30 trillion marketThe India-US trade deal marks a reset in trade ties, cutting Trump tariffs to 18 per cent and setting the stage for a sweeping bilateral deal amid geopolitical recalibrations.

US stocks hit historic milestone as Dow crosses 50,000 points for first timeUS stocks surged Friday as tech shares rebounded and bitcoin steadied, pushing the S&P 500, Dow and Nasdaq sharply higher despite lingering worries over heavy AI spending and market volatility.

How Google rode the AI wave to cross $400 billion in annual revenue for 1st timeGoogle said that the Gemini app alone has crossed 750 million monthly active users, showing that AI adoption is no longer limited to developers or businesses.

Fractal Analytics, Aye Finance IPOs to open next week: What investors should knowInvestors will have two fresh IPO opportunities next week as Fractal Analytics and Aye Finance open their public issues on February 9. The offerings span technology and finance, drawing attention from those looking to diversify their portfolios.

Bitcoin crash stuns markets. Decoding biggest crypto slump since Trump electionBitcoin has witnessed one of its sharpest corrections in recent years, wiping out more than $2 trillion from the global cryptocurrency market in a single day. The fall is the steepest since Donald Trump's election. It comes amid rising global risk aversion, weakness in technology and AI stocks, and sustained institutional selling pressure.
Sensex, Nifty rebound to close higher; IT stocks bleed to limit gainsThe S&P BSE Sensex added 266.47 points to close at 83,580.40, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 50.90 points to end at 25,693.70.

Why Ola, Uber and Rapido drivers are going on a 6-hour strike todayThe strike has been called by the Telangana Gig and Platform Workers Union, also known as TGPWU. The union represents app-based transport workers operating on platforms such as Ola, Uber and Rapido.

Gold jumps Rs 1,000, silver falls Rs 6,000: Should you buy now or wait longer?Recent swings in gold and silver prices have caught investors' attention, with the metals showing mixed trends after a strong run. The big question now is whether this is a pause before the next move — should you buy now or wait longer?

Is Budget 2026 putting services at the centre of India's growth strategy?Budget 2026, in essence, quietly recognises that India's economic growth and job creation are and will continue to be powered by services – both tradable and non-tradable, while maintaining the focus on infrastructure and manufacturing.

Can RBI's new measures make it easier to do business and boost credit flow?With the RBI announcing new steps to improve credit access and ease regulations, attention is turning to their real-world impact. Could these changes help businesses grow and borrow more smoothly?

entertainment.headline: 3rd rate actor from 3rd world country: Big B recalls old dig amid U19 World Cup win Amitabh Bachchan reflected on a foreign journalist's remark calling him a 'third-rate actor from a third-world country.' He shared the experience while celebrating India's sixth U19 World Cup victory.

So so sad: Manoj Bajpayee reacts to The Family Man 3 co-star Sunil Thapa's death Actor Manoj Bajpayee has expressed deep grief over the death of Sunil Thapa. In his latest Instagram post, he recalled the connection they shared while filming The Family Man 3.

Actress who said yes went off to America: Did Ektaa offer Naagin film to Priyanka? Ektaa Kapoor hinted an actor once said yes to her Naagin film but later left for America. Was it Priyanka Chopra? Here's what the producer revealed about the casting.

Priyanka Chopra mourns Sunil Thapa, recalls how he helped after her father's loss Actor Priyanka Chopra paid tribute to her Mary Kom co-actor Sunil Thapa, who died in Kathmandu after a cardiac arrest. The actor shared a heartfelt message recalling Thapa's support during her difficult times, especially after she lost her father.

Amid breakup rumours, Tara Sutaria says she's learned to protect her peace Actor Tara Sutaria said she has learned to protect her peace and prioritise calm amid public scrutiny. Her remarks come as breakup rumours with Veer Pahariya swirl, with neither confirming or denying the reports.

Akshay Kumar's Bhooth Bangla gets a new release date. Details inside The makers of Bhooth Bangla, starring Akshay Kumar and Tabu, have officially announced that the film will release in cinemas a month earlier than originally announced. The announcement was shared by Balaji Motion Pictures along with a promotional video.

Aneet Padda, Ahaan Panday's Saiyaara re-released in theatres? Here's what we know Mohit Suri's romantic drama Saiyaara was the biggest romantic film of 2025. Have the makers re-released the film in theatres in 2026 just ahead of Valentine's Day? Here's everything you need to know.

Amaal Mallik snaps at fan wars, wants to cancel song video with Farrhana Bhatt Music composer Amaal Mallik voiced concern over negativity among fan clubs following his collaboration announcement with Bigg Boss 19 co-contestant Farrhana Bhatt. He said the backlash has left him disturbed and hesitant to release his new song video.

Rupali Ganguly shares loved-up pics to celebrate 13 years of marriage with Ashwin Rupali Ganguly celebrated 13 years of marriage with husband Ashwin K. Verma by sharing romantic Maldives photos and a heartfelt note on social media.

AP Dhillon to debut his new track on The Great Indian Kapil Show. Details inside Punjabi singer AP Dhillon will perform his song 'Thinking of You' for the first time on Netflix's The Great Indian Kapil Show. He will be joined by comedian Anubhav Singh Bassi for a lively episode blending music and comedy.

Priyanka Chopra posts anniversary wish for brother Siddharth and wife Neelam. Video Priyanka Chopra celebrated her brother Siddharth Chopra and Neelam Upadhyaya's first wedding anniversary with a heartfelt video and message on social media.

Sunil Thapa, who played Priyanka Chopra's on-screen coach in Mary Kom, dies at 68 Sunil Thapa, known for his roles in Nepali and Indian cinema, died in Kathmandu after a cardiac arrest. He was 68 years old and had worked with Priyanka Chopra in Mary Kom.

Finding Harmony review: Kate Winslet narrates King Charles's timeless harmony pleaRelease Date:Fri Feb 06, 2026 Finding Harmony: A King's Vision, directed by Nicolas Brown and narrated by Kate Winslet, traces King Charles III's enduring environmental philosophy through sustainable development projects. A visually stunning reminder that true progress lies in harmony with nature. Here's our review.

Kareena Kapoor revisits Saif Ali Khan's 'LOC: Kargil' moment: Little we did know Kareena Kapoor Khan shared a throwback clip of Saif Ali Khan from LOC: Kargil, writing "Little we did know" and leaving fans nostalgic.

Rang De Basanti celebrates 20 years, Aamir Khan joins cast for nostalgic reunion The cast of Rang De Basanti reunited in Mumbai for a special screening as the iconic film completed 20 years since its release.

Ayushmann Khurrana cheers Vadh 2: Hearing great things about the film Ayushmann Khurrana extended his best wishes to the team of Vadh 2 after hearing positive reviews about the film, which opened in theatres on February 6.

A year filled with all things you love: Neha Dhupia's birthday wish for Angad Bedi Neha Dhupia shared a heartfelt birthday post for husband Angad Bedi, offering fans a glimpse into his favourite things along with unseen moments from his life.

Exclusive: Korean stars Choi Soo-young, Kim Jae-young on fans, obsession and India In exclusive conversations with India Today, leads Choi Soo-young and Kim Jae-young reflect on why the show has resonated deeply with Indian audiences. Both actors credit India's emotional storytelling sensibility for truly "understanding" IDOL I, calling the response heartfelt, thoughtful and deeply moving.

Dhurandhar's Ayesha Khan calls Nora Fatehi, Tamannaah incredible amid comparisons Ayesha Khan has reacted to comparisons with Nora Fatehi and Tamannaah Bhatia, saying she respects their work and would never measure herself against them.

general news.headline: 4 Indian students injured in knife attack at Russian medical college hostelThe Interior Ministry said initial reports indicate that a teenager armed with a knife entered the medical university dormitory and attacked students residing there, stabbing several individuals.

8 rescued, many feared trapped as restaurant building collapses in KotaPolice teams and ambulances rushed to the spot and immediately cordoned off the entire area to prevent crowds from gathering and to allow rescue operations to proceed smoothly.

T20 World Cup: Suryakumar special helps India avoid opening-day gloom vs USAT20 World Cup: Skipper Suryakumar Yadav's special unbeaten 84 helped India avoid opening-day gloom as the defending champions began their title defence with a nervy 29-run win over the USA at Mumbai's Wankhede Stadium on Saturday, February 7.

China conducted nuclear test days after Galwan clash, says Trump teamThe Donald Trump administration has accused China of conducting a secret nuclear test on June 22, 2020. This is just seven days after Indian and Chinese forces clashed in Galwan amid the border standoff in eastern Ladakh.

Video: Terrifying moment when 'tsunami' swing snaps mid-air, crashes to groundA horrifying incident took place at the annual Surajkund Mela in Faridabad when a joyride collapsed there on Saturday. According to officials, a policeman died from injuries he sustained while trying to rescue people as the tragedy unfolded. They added that 12 other people were injured. The incident took place when a 'tsunami' swing snapped mid-air and came crashing on to the ground. Police Inspector Jagdish Prasad tried to save people when the joyride began tilting but suffered fatal injuries, officials said, according to news agency ANI. He was declared brought dead at the hospital.

Cop dead, 12 injured as swing collapses at Surajkund fair in FaridabadA police inspector died, and 13 people were injured after a tsunami swing collapsed at the Surajkund Fair in Faridabad on Saturday.

Here's why it is important and marks a departure.

Biography of street fighter: Mamata and making of permanent political scrapperOn February 4, Mamata Banerjee created a bit of history. She became both the petitioner and pleader in the Supreme Court, causing eyebrows to be raised. But we shouldn't have been surprised. Showing up for the good fight is Mamata's credo, her political signature. She just can't outsource the good fight. She is not a politician who occasionally fights. She's a fighter who occasionally governs.

Software engineering will be obsolete in 12 months? Sridhar Vembu says pay attentionAnthropic CEO Dario Amodei has warned that software engineering could become obsolete within the next 12 months as AI systems take over most coding work. Now, Zoho founder Sridhar Vembu has reiterated the warning, saying it should not be ignored given that Anthropic already builds some of the most advanced AI tools for coding.

Everyone living in India is Hindu: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat lists 4 types of HindusRSS chief Mohan Bhagwat said everyone living in India is Hindu, calling Hindu an adjective, not a noun. He outlined four types of Hindus and said forgetting Hindu sentiment led to India's Partition.

DMK's reign to change hands? MK Stalin says son Udhayanidhi doing wonderful jobTamil Nadu CM MK Stalin praised Deputy CM Udhayanidhi Stalin for effectively taking the DMK to the youth and countering narratives about the party's appeal among young voters.

AAP leader Lucky Oberoi's murder: Key accused arrested after police encounterAAP leader Lucky Oberoi was shot dead on Friday morning outside a gurdwara in Jalandhar. The key accused in his murder case was arrested on Saturday.

sports.headline: How Siraj cancelled plans to watch Real Madrid after shock T20 World Cup call-up T20 World Cup: Mohammed Siraj had Real Madrid tickets booked for February 15th. Then came Suryakumar Yadav's call 24 hours before the World Cup opener. The pacer delivered three wickets on his dramatic return.

Agni, son of Vidhu Vinod Chopra, dismisses 'fake' reports linking him to PSL auction Agni Dev Chopra, son of filmmaker Vidhu Vinod Chopra and film critic Anupama Chopra, has dismissed reports linking him to the Pakistan Super League (PSL) 2026 auction as "fake and misleading".

Shubman Gill enjoys Man United's win vs Spurs during India's T20 WC opener India's Test and ODI captain Shubman Gill was spotted in Paris watching Manchester United beat Tottenham 2-0 while his T20 teammates scraped past the USA in their World Cup opener at Mumbai's Wankhede.

Kolkata's Eden debunks attendance fears, turns up for Scotland vs West Indies Kolkata's Eden Gardens brushed aside attendance concerns after Bangladesh pulled out of the T20 World Cup 2026, citing security issues, with Scotland stepping in to face the West Indies in their season opener.

Mohammad Kaif's blunt live-TV take on Babar Azam goes viral Pakistan secured a narrow three-wicket win over the Netherlands in their T20 World Cup opener. Babar Azam's slow batting tempo has sparked intense debate about his role in the modern T20 format.

Who is Shadley van Schalkwyk? USA pacer stuns India with three wickets in one over USA pacer Shadley van Schalkwyk produced a sensational spell to stun India on Saturday, claiming three wickets in a single over during their ICC T20 World Cup clash and leaving the defending champions in early disarray.

Rohit Sharma chants echo at Wankhede during T20 World Cup opening ceremony T20 World Cup 2026: Rohit Sharma, the tournament ambassador, brought the T20 World Cup onto the field of play ahead of India's opening match against the USA. The Wankhede Stadium cheered for the local hero, who led India to triumph in 2024.

ICC T20 World Cup 2026: 300 hopes up in smoke as USA rattle India in powerplay ICC T20 World Cup: Defending champions India endured a nightmare start in the batting powerplay against the USA in their tournament-opener with the top-order having a rare off day.

IND vs USA: Sanju Samson dropped, Jasprit Bumrah rested due to illnessT20 World Cup 2026: India dropped Sanju Samson from the XI to accommodate in-form Ishan Kishan for their opening match against the USA in Mumbai on Saturday. Mohammed Siraj, who replaced injured Harshit Rana, got a game straightaway after Jasprit Bumrah missed out due to illness.

India vs Pakistan match still on? Pak board, ICC in talks over boycott threatT20 World Cup 2026: The Pakistan Cricket Board has agreed to engage in further dialogue with the International Cricket Council after the global body questioned the Force Majeure clause invoked to justify boycotting the February 15 match against India in Colombo.

Rahmanullah Gurbaz pulls out of PSL days after joining Peshawar ZalmiAfghanistan wicketkeeper-batter Rahmanullah Gurbaz has opted out of the Pakistan Super League (PSL) 2026, after fellow Afghanistan international Naveen-ul-Haq earlier posted a cryptic message on Facebook.

New Zealand couldn't have had better T20 World Cup preps than playing India: Mitchell SantnerT20 World Cup 2026, NZ vs AFG: Speaking to the reporters before the clash against Afghanistan on Sunday, Mitchell Santner said that New Zealand couldn't have hoped for better preparations than playing a series against India. Before the mega event, the Kiwis played a bilateral series where India beat them 4-1.

India vs USA Highlights: India begin title defence with 29-run win over USAIndia (IND) vs USA Live Cricket Score, T20 World Cup 2026: Mohammed Siraj sealed the deal with a wicket to cap off a stellar return to the T20I side with the win over USA to begin their title defence.

Has Afghanistan moved past underdog tag? Rashid Khan opens up before New Zealand clashT20 World Cup 2026, NZ vs AFG: Speaking to the reporters, Rashid Khan opened up on whether Afghanistan have moved past the tag of underdogs. Rashid will have his task cut out when the Afghans start their campaign against New Zealand on Sunday in Chennai.

Faheem Ashraf's prayer answered: Pakistan star recalls Dutch wild ride in ColomboPakistan all-rounder Faheem Ashraf admitted he was holding his breath — every part of his body silently praying for a catch to go down—during the penultimate over of a tense but ultimately successful run chase against the Netherlands in their T20 World Cup opener on Saturday.

India stars Varun and Kuldeep visit Siddhivinayak temple on matchday morningT20 World Cup 2026: Indian cricketers Varun Chakravarthy and Kuldeep Yadav sought the blessings of the Almighty at Mumbai's famed Siddhivinayak Temple on the morning of their opening match against the USA.

Should Afghanistan back women's cricket? Rashid Khan breaks his silenceT20 World Cup, NZ vs AFG: Rashid Khan has spoken out on whether Afghanistan should encourage women's cricket in the country. Pakistan do a Pakistan, flirt with disaster against Netherlands on opening dayT20 World Cup 2026: Babar Azam's fielding magic teased a new professional era, but a classic middle-order collapse forced Pakistan to scramble for a heart-stopping, narrow victory over the Netherlands in their opening match in Colombo on Saturday.

Glazer brothers bid for IPL team: ReportPremier League giants Manchester United could be headed for a major IPL crossover, with co-owner Avram Glazer reportedly placing a massive bid for Royal Challengers Bengaluru. If it goes through, the deal could be one of the biggest in sporting history.

WI vs SCO highlights: Hat-trick hero Romario Shepherd leads West Indies' winWest Indies (WI) vs Scotland (SCO) highlights, T20 World Cup 2026: West Indies have taken an emphatic win with Romario Shepherd having a game for the ages as his hat-trick and five-wicket haul led to the two-time champions getting the win by 35 runs.

USA have done their T20 World Cup homework on favourites India: Saurabh NetravalkarUSA may be the underdogs, but Saurabh Netravalkar insists they are not walking in blind against India. Catch of the T20 World Cup? Babar Azam ensures Pakistan dodge the memesPakistan shrugged off opening-day jitters with a rare fielding masterclass. Babar Azam's stunning relay catch set the tone in their T20 World Cup 2026 opener against the Netherlands in Colombo.

BCCI announces Rs 7.5 crore reward for India's U19 World Cup championsIndia's Under-19 World Cup celebrations got bigger as the BCCI announced a Rs 7.5 crore reward for the new champions. The cash prize comes after Ayush Mhatre's unbeaten side crushed England by 100 runs in Harare.

Pakistan to rethink India boycott stance? PCB to consult govt over Sri Lanka pleaT20 World Cup 2026: Pakistan Cricket Board will consult the government again after Sri Lanka Cricket warned of financial and reputational losses if the marquee clash against India is boycotted. The Pakistan government said the senior national men's team will not play India in Colombo on February 15.

Bumrah doubtful for India's T20 World Cup opener vs USA: ReportsJasprit Bumrah is reportedly doubtful for India's T20 World Cup 2026 opener against USA after missing training with a mild fever. With tougher Group A games ahead, India may rest him as a precaution.

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
